name: Mid-Career Pathways Programme for Mature Mid-career Individuals
description: The Mid-Career Pathways Programme is a full-time attachment programme for mature mid-career individuals aged 40 and above who are looking for a switch in careers. Suitable applicants will be attached to a host organisation where they can gain meaningful industry-relevant skills and experience. The attachments will last between four to six months.

name: Employment Support for Seniors
description: Employment Support for Seniors is a programme supported by Workforce Singapore, and administered by Centre for Seniors (CFS). It provides career advisory and job matching services to senior jobseekers aged 50 and above.

name: SkillsFuture Jobseeker Support scheme
description: The SkillsFuture Jobseeker Support scheme provides temporary financial support of up to $6,000 over 6 months to involuntarily unemployed individuals, to support them in finding a job that makes better use of their skills and experiences.

name: Career Conversion Programmes (CCPs) for Employers
description: CCPs help companies to meet manpower needs by providing funding support for reskilling of mid-career new hires and workers into in-demand growth jobs. Benefits include up to 90% salary support and industry-recognised on-the-job training across around 30 sectors.

name: Environmental Services Job Redesign Initiative
description: Supporting ES enterprises to leverage job redesign to complement and sustain business and workforce transformation efforts. Benefits include curated support for the ES industry, professional JR consultancy, and job redesign reskilling salary support.

name: Hiring Opportunities (Yellow Ribbon)
description: This programme aims to help ex-offenders become job-ready and prepare them for re-integration into the workforce. Benefits include access to an alternative worker pool and career retention support.

name: Job Redesign Centre of Excellence (JRCoE)
description: A one-stop resource to equip enterprises with capabilities to embark on business and workforce transformation journey through JR. Benefits include capability development workshops, guided sectoral JR playbooks, and HR resources on workforce planning.

name: Mid-Career Pathways Programme for Host Organisations
description: Take on mature mid-career individuals on attachments to support business needs with government funding. Benefits include tapping on the experience of mature individuals, 70% of training allowance funding, and continued funding for early conversions.

name: Overseas Markets Immersion Programme (OMIP) for Employers
description: Expand your business to overseas market and improve global mobility by investing in a global-ready workforce. Benefits include access to new markets, increased employer value proposition, and reduced cost of developing global talent.

name: Employment Support for Employers to hire Persons with Disabilities (PWDs)
description: Gain access to subsidies, grants, and employment facilitation services to help hire and integrate PWDs into the organisations. Benefits include course fee subsidy, job redesign grant, and recruitment and job support services.

name: Environmental Services Job Redesign Initiative
description: Supporting ES enterprises to leverage job redesign to complement and sustain business and workforce transformation efforts. Benefits include curated support for the ES industry, access to professional JR consultancy, and job redesign reskilling salary support.

name: Support for Job Redesign under Productivity Solutions Grant
description: To find out how your company can incorporate job redesign and kick start your workforce transformation.

name: SkillsFuture Credit
description: Course fee for Training Pathway is eligible for SkillsFuture Credit.

name: Employment Support for Seniors
description: Employment Support for Seniors is a programme supported by Workforce Singapore, administered by Centre for Seniors (CFS), to provide career advisory and job matching services to senior jobseekers aged 50 and above.

name: Workfare Skills Support (WSS) Scheme
description: WSS encourages lower-wage workers to undertake training that leads to more impactful employment outcomes. Benefits include a Training Allowance at $6 per hour, capped at 180 training hours per eligibility period, a Training Commitment Award of up to $1,000 for courses attained during eligibility period, and Absentee Payroll for Sponsoring employers up to 95% of hourly basic salary capped at $13 per hour.

name: Mid-Career Pathways Programme for Mature Mid-career Individuals
description: The Mid-Career Pathways Programme is a full-time attachment programme for mature mid-career individuals aged 40 and above who are looking for a switch in careers. Suitable applicants will be attached to a host organisation where they can gain meaningful industry-relevant skills and experience. The attachments will last between four to six months.

name: Career Trial
description: Career Trial aims to encourage jobseekers and host companies who are unsure about the job fit to go through a short-term trial before considering formal employment. It is targeted at full-time jobs paying at least $1,500/month and part-time jobs paying at least $750/month.
agency: Workforce Singapore (WSG) and the Employment and Employability Institute (NTUCâ€™s e2i)

name: Career Conversion Programmes (CCP)
description: Career Conversion Programmes (CCPs) are conversion programmes targeted at mid-career individuals, to undergo skills conversion and switch to new jobs or sectors that have good longer-term prospects. Long-term unemployed or mature jobseekers aged 40 and above are eligible for higher funding support.

name: SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy
description: You can receive up to 90% course fee subsidies for SSG-supported courses. Eligible for Singaporeans aged 40 and above.

name: SkillsFuture Credit
description: Offset your course fees with up to $1,500 SkillsFuture Credit. Inclusive of opening and one-off top-up credit of $500 each, and Additional SkillsFuture Credit (Mid-Career Support) of $500 given to Singapore Citizens aged 40 to 60 (both ages inclusive) as at 31 December 2020.

name: Polaris
description: Polaris is a personalised programme designed for employed individuals who are looking to elevate their career through Career Planning. This personalised programme comprises three coaching sessions with a certified career coach. The career coach will support you in shaping a robust Career Development Plan, tailored exclusively to fuel your professional growth, harmonising your strengths, values and aspirations.

name: CareersFinder by MyCareersFuture
description: Chart your path to a successful career with CareersFinder, a new feature on MyCareersFuture that empowers you to discover personalised upskilling and career recommendations by analysing your unique profile.

name: CareersCompass by MyCareersFuture
description: Discover everything you need to thrive in today's job market with CareersCompass by MyCareersFuture. A one-stop destination packed with essential knowledge and tools, including expert insights on job search, career development, talent acquisition strategies, and more.

name: Career Conversion Programmes (CCPs)
description: CCPs support mid-career individuals to reskill and develop new capabilities to take on new job roles in growth areas.

name: Career Grit
description: Strengthen your career health with Career GRIT's events and resources for better employment opportunities and long-term professional growth.

name: Speak to a volunteer Career Advisor
description: Tap on the expertise of volunteer Career Advisors for sector-specific career advice that can help you make more informed career decisions.

name: HerCareer Initiative
description: Women who have taken a career break and are thinking of re-joining the workforce can look forward to some government programmes and services to guide you through the job search process.

name: Jobs Transformation Maps
description: Refer to the Jobs Transformations Maps (JTMs) to discover how job roles will transform alongside key technologies to prepare for the future of work and identify career opportunities.

name: SkillsFuture Career Transition Programme
description: Supports mid-career individuals in acquiring industry-relevant skills to improve employability and pivot to new sectors or job roles. It is a train-and-place programme that is available on a part-time or full-time format, ranging from three to 12 months with course fee funding support.

description: Built for enterprises to access the right capital for financing operational cashflow needs.

name: Energy Efficiency Grant (Base)
description: A company that meets all the following criteria can apply for the EEG (Base): Business entity registered and operating in Singapore in the Manufacturing, Food Services or Retail sector as defined below; Manufacturing companies that are classified under SSIC 10 to 32 (including Food Manufacturing); Food Services companies with valid Singapore Food Agency (SFA) licences and classified under SSICs 56 or 68104; Retail companies that are classified under SSIC 47; Has a minimum of 30% local shareholding; Employ at least one local employee at the firm-level; Has a Group Annual Sales Turnover no more than S$500 million.

name: SkillsFuture Enterprise Credit (SFEC)
description: For programmes under Enterprise Transformation (e.g. EDG, MRA, PSG etc), you may log in to Business Grants Portal (BGP) to obtain the claim breakdown details. For programmes under Workforce Transformation (e.g. SFEC-eligible training courses), you may log in to SkillsFuture for Business page to obtain the claim breakdown details.

name: Global Tech Talent Alliance
description: Leverage talent service providers as you build your tech team for effective market entry.

name: Tech@SG
description: Get government endorsement for up to ten new Employment Passes to build your team in Singapore.

name: Innovation Advisors Programme
description: Tap on experienced professionals to build partnerships, scale, and achieve accelerated growth.

name: EntrePass
description: Establish your startup in Singapore and gain access to the vibrant local tech startup community.

name: Eureka Resilience Call 2024
description: The Eureka Resilience Call is jointly administered by EnterpriseSG and 14 other funding agencies. This programme aims to encourage the development of ready-to-market solutions for products, technology-based services or methods that have strong commercial potential in the field(s) of disaster resilience, response and recovery.

name: Enterprise Development Grant (Co-Innovation Programme)
description: The Enterprise Development Grant (Co-Innovation Programme), or EDG (CIP), supports Singapore-based companies and their overseas partners to collaborate on R&D projects. Eligible companies can receive up to 50% support for qualifying cost items, with a focus on developing new products or solutions with strong market potential.

name: Enterprise Development Grant (Co-Innovation Programme)
description: The Enterprise Development Grant (Co-Innovation Programme), or EDG (CIP), supports Singapore-based companies and their overseas partners to collaborate on R&D projects. Eligible companies can receive up to 50% support for qualifying cost items, focusing on innovation activities such as joint R&D projects that result in new products or solutions with strong market potential.

name: Startup SG Equity
description: Co-invest into Singapore-based technology startups with intellectual property and global market potential.

name: Venture Capital Fund Incentive (VCFI)
description: Get tax exemption on qualifying income streams for a period of up to 15 years.

name: Fund Management Incentive (FMI)
description: Receive a concessionary tax rate of 5% for a period of up to 5 years as a fund management company.

name: Startup SG Talent
description: Support for talent sourcing and international founders. Bring the right talent onboard to grow and scale your business. Gain access to Singaporeâ€™s vibrant startup ecosystem via an entrepreneurial work visa.

name: Startup SG Founder
description: Mentorship and funding support for first-time entrepreneurs. Access to mentorship and funding from Accredited Mentor Partners (AMPs). Applicants will be evaluated based on their business concept, feasibility of business model, strength of management team, and potential market value.

name: Startup SG Tech
description: Support for deep tech commercialisation. Provides early-stage funding to fast-track the development of proprietary technology. Supports Proof-of-Concept (POC) and Proof-of-Value (POV) for commercialisation of innovative and proprietary technologies.

name: Startup SG Accelerator
description: Support for incubators and accelerators to catalyse the growth of startups. Provides funding and non-financial support to local and global startup enablers in Singapore. Applicants will be evaluated based on their unique value proposition and track record in nurturing innovative startups in areas such as access to markets, talents and financing.

name: Startup SG Equity
description: Co-investment opportunities for investors that provide funding support for high potential startups. Co-invest with independent, qualified third party investors into eligible startups. Invest in selected venture capital firms that in turn invest in eligible startups, through a fund-of-funds approach.

name: Startup SG Infrastructure
description: Infrastructural support for startups, multipliers and investors. JTC Launchpads brings together a diverse community of startups, accelerators, incubators, venture capitalist (VC) firms, and ecosystem players in a communal environment, to spur knowledge sharing and collaboration.

name: Startup SG Loan
description: Government-backed loans via the Enterprise Financing Scheme (EFS). Provides access to seven financing areas to catalyse startupsâ€™ growth opportunities.

name: Startup SG Network
description: Networking and collaboration opportunities through a connected community of ecosystem players. Allows startups to profile themselves and connect with local and global ecosystem players. Drives network building for potential business partnerships.

name: Startup SG Equity
description: Co-invest into Singapore-based technology startups with intellectual property and global market potential.

name: Venture Capital Fund Incentive (VCFI)
description: Get tax exemption on qualifying income streams for a period of up to 15 years.

name: Fund Management Incentive (FMI)
description: Receive a concessionary tax rate of 5% for a period of up to 5 years as a fund management company.

name: Enterprise Development Grant (EDG)
description: The EDG enables Singapore firms to grow and transform by supporting projects to upgrade their business, innovate or venture overseas.

name: Global Ready Talent Programme
description: The talent programme helps firms to offer internships and other work opportunities to attract students and fresh graduates.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant
description: The Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG) helps Singapore companies improve their productivity and automate existing processes through IT solutions and equipment. It offers up to 50% of eligible costs for local SMEs, with support for sector-specific and generic solutions that are pre-approved by EnterpriseSG and other participating agencies.

description: Tap on EDG for projects that help you upgrade, innovate, grow and transform your business.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant
description: The Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG) supports companies keen on adopting IT solutions and equipment to enhance business processes. PSG covers sector-specific solutions including customer management, data analytics, financial management, and inventory tracking.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
description: The PSG supports businesses in the adoption of IT solutions/equipment/consultancy service that improve productivity. It provides funding for the purchase/lease/hire of pre-approved equipment or IT solution packages.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
description: The Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG) helps Singapore companies improve their productivity and automate existing processes through IT solutions and equipment. Up to 50% of eligible costs for local SMEs. Receive up to $30,000 and improve your business productivity. Sector-specific and generic solutions are pre-approved by EnterpriseSG and other participating agencies.

name: Enterprise Development Grant (EDG)
description: The Enterprise Development Grant (EDG) supports projects that help you upgrade, innovate, grow and transform your business. Submit your individual project proposals with details on your business plans and project outcomes to take your business further. EDG funds qualifying project costs namely third-party consultancy fees, software and equipment, and internal manpower cost.

name: Market Readiness Assistance (MRA) Grant
description: The Market Readiness Assistance (MRA) grant helps companies expand into new markets overseas by defraying the costs of overseas market promotion, business development and set-up. The enhanced MRA grant cap of up to S$100,000 will be extended until 31 March 2025.

name: Enterprise Sustainability Programme
description: Integrate sustainability into your business to capture new opportunities in the green economy.

name: Internationalisation Grant
description: EnterpriseSG provided Lucence with an internationalisation grant, which helped in the set-up of its Palo Alto laboratory in 2020.

name: Enterprise Singapore Grants
description: Enterprise Singapore provides grants to help companies expand their capabilities and internationalisation efforts.
